title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.4: COMMUNITY POSITIVE BEHAVE

description.narrative: By 2020, the general public, community leaders, parents and adolescents are more knowledgeable and better equipped to confront negative gender norms and issues facing adolescent girls in a violent urban context., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially girls, have access to appropriate and sustainable child protection services in a favourable social environment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the general public, community leaders, parents and adolescents are more knowledgeable and better equipped to confrontnegative gender norms and issues facing adolescent girls in a violent urban context.

description.narrative: The results of the national Violence Against Children survey (2019 VAC survey) published in September 2020 demonstrated high levels of violence against girls and boys in Côte d’Ivoire. The Country Office elevated violence as a national priority through high-visibility media actions targeting parents, adolescents, and the general public at large. Video ads onReimagining Cote d’Ivoire without violence against childrenwhich included positive messages from children were broadcasted on national TV channels ahead of the launch of the national violence initiative. A six-episode TV series on sexual violence was produced and ready for broadcasting early 2021. | Status:Not met | As-of Date:19/01/2021
